intro: Mitrasacme patens, commonly known as the white-flowered mitrasacme, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its attractive, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, featuring opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth texture. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, with five petals and a distinctive corona. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
